page.title: 10THE CAPTAIN'S WIFE
page.content: The Captain's Wife got its name from a very old ghost story. A long time ago a sea captain (we don't know his name) married the lady of the manor. The lady wanted the captain to stay in the manor and the captain wished to take his wife to sea. There were many rows. Then on the voyage the captain forced his wife on board. Later, at sea, the captain returned to his cabin to find his wife dead. The captain, knowing the sailors' superstitious attitude towards having a corpse on the ship, put the body in a sea chest. When the ship docked, he buried her body in the chest in the woods. It is assumed that some sailors saw him, thought he was burying treasure and took it away because, when the captain returned, the chest
